description.narrative: The objective of this project is to build institutional capacity of the Alliance of Small Island States (AOSIS) to enable the group to engage actively in the negotiations under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC).

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 -Increased capacity of AOSIS to cover negotiation topics in the UNFCCC process (measured by recruitment of technical staff) 1.2 increased awareness of AOSIS positions in the media (measured by press releases, media statements) 1.3 effective AOSIS UNFCCC delegation management 2.1 Organisation of, and participation rate in, AOSIS hosted meetings; qualitative assessments of the outcomes of such meetings with respect to the impact of joint-negotiation positions derived and areas for further collaboration between like-minded groups in the negotiations.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Pre-project technical support available to the Members and Chair of AOSIS via Permanent Mission of Antigua and Barbuda to the UN 2.1 Pre-project levels of AOSIS engagement in UNFCCC activities

- Increased capacity of AOSIS to cover negotiation topics in the UNFCCC process (measured by recruitment of technical staff). - Increased awareness of AOSIS positions in the media (measured by press releases, media statements). - Effective AOSIS UNFCCC delegation management. - Increased number of newly recruited AOSIS UNFCCC delegates, number of training sessions for newly recruited delegates, and participation of new delegates in UNFCCC meetings. - Greater technical-level coordination among AOSIS experts, enhanced engagement at the national level and high-level political engagement in AOSIS UNFCCC activities, increased awareness among like-minded partners of AOSIS positions (in particular on Mitigation Ambition), and enhanced collaboration between AOSIS, African countries, and LDCs on the discussions under the Durban Platform for Enhanced Action. - Enhanced participation by AOSIS in the UNFCCC process to build institutional memory and capacity and to increase high level engagement of AOSIS at the level of Ministers and Heads of State and Government.

The Permanent Mission of Belize to the United Nations has successfully carried out its duties as the Chair of AOSIS during 2019-2020:
Under Output 1, UNDP has supported the AOSIS Chair in strengthening the delegations’ capacity to participate and negotiate in the UNFCCC process and beyond. Three technical experts supported negotiations. The project also supported travel overheads for AOSIS Chair, AOSIS Lead Negotiator for Climate Change, Lead Negotiator for Sustainable Development, Communication Adviser and Programme Adviser to participate in various regional and international negotiation meetings.
The composition of the AOSIS Technical Team for 2019-2020 is as follows: (1) Lead Climate Change Negotiator (2) Technical Expert for Climate Change, Oceans and Multilateral Environment Agreements (3) Lead Negotiator for Sustainable Development (4) Technical Expert for Sustainable Development (5) Technical Team Coordinator and Team Administrator (6) Communications Adviser (7) Programme Adviser and Manager
Under Output 2, UNDP has supported the AOSIS Chair to overcome financial and technical barriers faced by SIDS member states in developing and coordinating group positions in major international fora. It also provided support for the participation of the Chair of AOSIS and its technical experts at relevant meetings and workshops. This consisted of funding travel and cover meeting and workshop expenses.

- Increased capacity of AOSIS to cover negotiation topics in the UNFCCC process (measured by recruitment of technical staff). - Increased awareness of AOSIS positions in the media (measured by press releases, media statements). - Effective AOSIS UNFCCC delegation management. - Increased number of newly recruited AOSIS UNFCCC delegates, number of training sessions for newly recruited delegates, and participation of new delegates in UNFCCC meetings. - Greater technical-level coordination among AOSIS experts, enhanced engagement at the national level and high-level political engagement in AOSIS UNFCCC activities, increased awareness among like-minded partners of AOSIS positions (in particular on Mitigation Ambition), and enhanced collaboration between AOSIS, African countries, and LDCs on the discussions under the Durban Platform for Enhanced Action. - Enhanced participation by AOSIS in the UNFCCC process to build institutional memory and capacity and to increase high level engagement of AOSIS at the level of Ministers and Heads of State and Government.

The Permanent Mission of Belize to the United Nations has successfully carried out its duties as the Chair of AOSIS during 2019-2020:
Under Output 1, UNDP has supported the AOSIS Chair in strengthening the delegations’ capacity to participate and negotiate in the UNFCCC process and beyond. Three technical experts supported negotiations. The project also supported travel overheads for AOSIS Chair, AOSIS Lead Negotiator for Climate Change, Lead Negotiator for Sustainable Development, Communication Adviser and Programme Adviser to participate in various regional and international negotiation meetings.
The composition of the AOSIS Technical Team for 2019-2020 is as follows: (1) Lead Climate Change Negotiator (2) Technical Expert for Climate Change, Oceans and Multilateral Environment Agreements (3) Lead Negotiator for Sustainable Development (4) Technical Expert for Sustainable Development (5) Technical Team Coordinator and Team Administrator (6) Communications Adviser (7) Programme Adviser and Manager
Under Output 2, UNDP has supported the AOSIS Chair to overcome financial and technical barriers faced by SIDS member states in developing and coordinating group positions in major international fora. It also provided support for the participation of the Chair of AOSIS and its technical experts at relevant meetings and workshops. This consisted of funding travel and cover meeting and workshop expenses.

1.1 Activity Result: Human Resource Recruitment (see attached Terms of Reference) & Financial reporting services
Actions:
(1) Lead Climate Change Negotiator. (2) Technical Expert for Climate Change, Oceans and other Multilateral Environment Agreements. (3) Lead Negotiator for Sustainable Development. (4) Technical Expert for Sustainable Development. (5) Technical Team Coordinator and Team Administrator. (6) Communications Adviser. (7) Programme Adviser and Manager
2.1 Activity Result: Conduct coordination meetings, fund participation in such meetings, and fund participation in Conferences and HL meetings
Actions:
(a) AOSIS Strategy & Coordination meetings (b) AOSIS Leaders meetings (c) AOSIS Ministerial Meeting (d) AOSIS Mitigation Ambition Meeting (e) AOSIS/ LDC/ Africa Meeting (f) support AOSIS Permanent Representatives/Senior Officials Travel/Per Diem for UNFCCC conferences (g) support AOSIS Coordinators, experts, and advisors Travel/Per Diem for UNFCCC conferences and related meetings

• Commenced operations as AOSIS Chair, recruiting full complement of negotiators and advisors, drafted 2-year work plan covering outreach activities of the Chair as well as negotiation priorities and activities in climate change, sustainable development and oceans through internal AOSIS consultations, and organized meetings with traditional partners to publicize workplan. • On climate change, lead intensive consultations to develop AOSIS positions on all coordination areas in advance of COP26, supported the participation of AOSIS Chair in multiple high-level climate events, and coordinated AOSIS at virtual intersessional meetings. • On sustainable development, enhanced AOSIS engagement on macro-economic issues, including principles for aid effectiveness and development of a multi-dimensional vulnerability index, through a series of events and consultations with AOSIS members and partners; • On oceans, significantly expanded AOSIS engagement and coordination on oceans issues, including on sea level rise and marine plastic pollution, through events and partnerships with other states. • Increased activity by the PSIDS on oceans and sustainable development, including through increased statements and interventions, increased engagement in UN processes and increased PSIDS coordination.
